While you can be compassionate and understanding. Ultimately  safely delivering product with an acceptable amount of blemishes. Is part of the job. However this responsibility do not solely rest on the shoulders of the rider imo
It could also be the food providerâ€™s packaging issue or overloading of jobs from service provider  building on stress applied to the rider to deliver your consumables in a timely fashion.

Your complaint could highlight a tendency or weak link in the supply chain.Either helping service provider identify if this is an isolated incident  unique to this rider. If the incident is unique to this rider then maybe heâ€™s need to go easier on his speed because definitely youâ€™re not the only ordered thatâ€™s affect.Or maybe itâ€™s to the food providerâ€™s packaging not very suited to be delivered in that particular way. After all  just because they wrap the food plastic container and plastic bag donâ€™t mean itâ€™s going to be 100% spill-free. Especially so because a food delivery thermal bag is not exactly an world class secure equipment.

Despite a recent hip replacement surgery  Uncle Joe remains upbeat and steadfast in serving at Sengkang South self-collection centre where he has become good friends with the residents. He greets them with a smile. Uncle Joe wants them to know that he is there for them in this trying time. Just like Uncle Joe  we too can do our part! Let us support Uncle Joe in his quest to help others by donating to Food from the Heart. Your contribution will help feed hungry bellies. Put a smile on many faces by your simple act of kindness. Latest update.Just been sent this ğŸ‘€ğŸ¤·ğŸ»â€â™‚My m8 who is high up in fire brigade just sent me this -Government's roadmap to ease Covid-19 restrictions will be set out in 5 phases. These phases will be on 3 week review process  the current phases would commence on the following dates:Phase 1 - 18th MayPhase 2 - 8th JunePhase 3 - 29th JunePhase 4 - 20th JulyPhase 5 - 10th AugustIf coronavirus cases begin to increase  we will revert to the restrictions set out in the previous stage.ğŸ”® PHASE 1 ğŸ”®Phase 1 of the roadmap will lift the following restrictions:ğŸ”¸ Construction workers  landscape gardeners and other outdoor workers may return to workğŸ”¸ Garden centres  repair shops and hardware stores may reopenğŸ”¸ Fitness & sport activities (non-contact) in small groups (max of 4 people) may resume (golf included)ğŸ”¸  People may meet up with friends and family in small groups outdoors (size of a "small group" is defined as up to 4 people)ğŸ”¸ The majority of regular health services will resumeğŸ”¸ Outdoor public amenities and tourism sites may reopen (beaches & mountain walks)*NOTE - social distancing guidelines will remain in operation for allğŸ”® PHASE 2 ğŸ”®Phase 2 of the roadmap will lift the following restrictions:ğŸ”¸ Restriction will be extended from 5km to 20kmğŸ”¸ Specific retail hours will be allocated for those currently cocooningğŸ”¸ Home visits will be allowed to those cocooning  by a small number of persons for a short period of timeğŸ”¸ Up to 4 people may visit another household for a short period of timeğŸ”¸ Slightly larger family gatherings at funerals will be permitted (limited to maximum safe social distancing can still be applied)ğŸ”¸ Solitary workers and workers that can maintain social distancing can return to workğŸ”¸ Small retail outlets that can control staff and customer numbers and maintain social distancing may reopenğŸ”¸ Public libraries will reopenğŸ”¸ Outdoor sporting activities  involving small group training (no matches) can recommenced (no contact still allowed)ğŸ”® PHASE 3 ğŸ”®Phase 3 of the roadmap will lift the following restrictions:ğŸ”¸ Commence opening of creches and pre-schools for children of essential workersğŸ”¸ Commence a phased approach to visiting at hospitals and other healthcare settingsğŸ”¸ Businesses where employees have low levels of daily interaction may reopenğŸ”¸ Phase in the opening of all other non-essential retail outlets  restricting customer numbers and applying social distancing (limited to retail outlets with street level entrance and exit  i.e. not in shopping centres)ğŸ”¸ Playgrounds will be reopenedğŸ”¸ 'Behind closed doors' sporting events may recommenceğŸ”¸ Cafes and restaurants may reopen as long as social distancing is maintainedğŸ”® PHASE 4 ğŸ”®Phase 4 of the roadmap will lift the following restrictions:ğŸ”¸ Travel will be extended to outside of your regionğŸ”¸ Larger household visits will be permittedğŸ”¸ Small social gatherings will be permitted (baptisms  small weddings etc.)ğŸ”¸ Creches and pre-schools will reopen for all other childrenğŸ”¸ Other employees return to work - beginning with those who cannot work remotely and then staggering the working times to ensure social distancingğŸ”¸ Barbers and hairdressers may reopenğŸ”¸ Museums and other cultural outlets may reopenğŸ”¸ Sports teams (GAA & soccer) may recommence and public swimming pools may reopenğŸ”¸ Hotels and other hospitality units may reopen based on limited occupancy. Hotel bars are to remain closed.ğŸ”® PHASE 5 ğŸ”®Phase 5 of the roadmap will lift the following restrictions:ğŸ”¸ Social gatherings will be permitted except for large gathering and gatherings in households of suspect casesğŸ”¸ Schools and colleges will reopen on a phased basis and will recommence in the new academic yearğŸ”¸ Normal hospital and other residential setting visits will be allowedğŸ”¸ All employees may return to work on normal onsite arrangements  except organisations that cannot maintain social distancing plansğŸ”¸ Enclosed shopping centres may reopen

ğŸ”¸ Tattoo and piercing parlors may reopenğŸ”¸ Cinemas may reopenğŸ”¸ Close contact physical sports may recommence (rugby  boxing etc.)ğŸ”¸ Gyms and dance studios may reopenğŸ”¸ Mass sporting events may recommence where social distancing can be maintainedğŸ”¸ Indoor recreational venues may reopen (bowling  bingo etc.)ğŸ”¸Small festivals and other outdoor cultural events may resumeğŸ”¸ Tourist travel to offshore islands may resume#StayHomeStaySafe
